transcript: his speedy arrival at Bald Hills with his wife. This pleasure will be but a brief one, how- ever, for he will leave us again to take part in this unhappy war into which we have been drawn, God knows how or why. Not only where you are at the heart of affairs and of the world is the talk all of war, even here amid fieldwork and the calm of nature which townsfolk consider char- acteristic of the country rumors of war are heard and painfully felt. My father talks of nothing but marches and count
